title: Diffused Responsibility: Analyzing the Energy Consumption of Generative Text-to-Audio Diffusion Models
author: Riccardo Passoni (Politecnico di Milano), Francesca Ronchini (Politecnico di Milano), Luca Comanducci (Politecnico di Milano), Romain Serizel (Université de Lorraine, CNRS, Inria), Fabio Antonacci (Politecnico di Milano)
relevance_why: The methodology for analyzing energy consumption in text-to-audio models can inform the efficiency of Haohe Liu's generative audio research, particularly concerning energy-aware model deployment.
background: This paper examines how the energy consumption of Generative Text-to-Audio models varies with parameters like inference steps and batch size.
contribution: This paper introduces an analysis framework for energy consumption in text-to-audio diffusion models, addressing the trade-offs between audio quality and energy efficiency.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on model accuracy without addressing energy efficiency.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work provides a detailed energy evaluation framework, emphasizing the importance of energy consumption during inference, which has been overlooked in prior studies.

key_innovation: By integrating energy consumption metrics into the evaluation of text-to-audio models, this research promotes a more sustainable approach to audio generation.
real_world_impact: The findings can help practitioners choose models that balance performance with environmental impact, influencing future designs in generative audio technologies.
limitations: The analysis mainly focuses on inference time and does not consider the training phase, which is significantly energy-intensive.

new_terms.Pareto frontier: **Pareto frontier** is a set of optimal solutions in a multi-objective optimization scenario where no objective can be improved without worsening another.
new_terms.Fr\u00e9chet Audio Distance: **Fréchet Audio Distance (FAD)** is a metric for assessing the quality of generated audio by measuring the distance between distributions of generated and real audio samples.

open_sourcing: The code used for this analysis is available at https://anonymous.4open.science/r/DiffGenEnergy.
